title-group.article-title: Shareholder Wealth and Stock Repurchases by Bank Holding Companies

abstract.p: This study examines the impact of stock repurchases on bank holding company (BHC) shareholders from two perspectives. The evidence suggests that the market does not react significantly to share repurchase announcements. Repurchase announcements, however, are associated with an increase in the unsystematic (firm specific) risk of BHC stocks. These results provide additional empirical evidence on the sensitivity of the financial markets to capital structure shifts by BHCs. The study also provides empirical evidence that supplements Billingsley and Thompsons [5] study of the financial determinants of BHC stock repurchases.
